intro: Dunstervillea mirabilis, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow and green flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees without deriving nutrients from them. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing a waxy surface to reduce water loss. Dunstervillea mirabilis thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
